meanings.definition: Past tense of 'overshoot': to go beyond or exceed a target or limit.
meanings.sent1: The car overshot the finish line in the race.
meanings.sent2: She overshot her budget when shopping for clothes.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overshot the tree branch and landed in a pile of leaves.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project overshot all expectations.
meanings.sent5: The arrow overshot the target and landed in the bushes.

meanings.definition: Adjective: having passed or gone beyond a target or limit.
meanings.sent1: The overshot rocket flew higher than expected.
meanings.sent2: Her overshot enthusiasm was contagious to the team.
meanings.sent3: The overshot balloon floated away into the sky.
meanings.sent4: The overshot river flooded the nearby fields.
meanings.sent5: The overshot goal celebration lasted late into the night.

meanings.definition: Noun: a type of weaving pattern where the weft thread passes over two or more warp threads.
meanings.sent1: The overshot design on the fabric looked intricate.
meanings.sent2: She admired the overshot pattern on the rug.
meanings.sent3: The overshot weaving technique created a beautiful texture.
meanings.sent4: The overshot cloth was perfect for making blankets.
meanings.sent5: The overshot weave added depth to the tapestry.
